content.title: Official Singles Chart on 23/12/2022
content.description: The Official UK Singles Chart reflects the UK’s biggest songs of the week, based on audio and video streams, downloads, CDs and vinyl, compiled by the Official Charts Company. The UK Top 40 is broadcast on BBC Radio 1, the Top 100 is published exclusively on OfficialCharts.com. View the biggest songs of 2024 so far.

drupalComments.title: da781b08-2218-4124-947c-5cb988a042cd
drupalComments.body: This is the 16th to 22nd December data countdown , the run up to Christmas. The Christmas weeks charts is from 30th December and the truly official Christmas #1 with units from 23rd to 29th. See tommorow for the nation Christmas chart of 2022

drupalComments.title: 293733f3-45b1-43cc-95f4-591b814cd82e
drupalComments.body: Again Ladbaby.... I fully support the idea of charity songs but he just spoils the whole idea of the Christmas #1.....

drupalComments.title: 2360417d-42cb-4df1-99b4-5007d3803903
drupalComments.body:
oh wanted to ask: anyone going to see the new whitney houston movie? if you've seen it, i'd love to hear your feedback. her sister in law, pat houston, & clive davis (record executive who signed her and became a life long friend and mentor to her) are involved in this movie.

& i feel, that FINALLY, there's a movie that accurately tells her life story. believe me, i've been a fan of hers since 1985 and there's so much more to her life than just drugs & drama. she was also a beautiful person inside & out and worked very hard to make it in music.

drupalComments.title: 2e99728e-c93b-4399-b133-c836034d00e7
drupalComments.body:
hey mates, here's a top 10+ list of xmas songs by current & past american acts as well as international artists who've hit it big here & made xmas albums. i left out wham, mariah and many other familiar tracks just to show love to everyone else...hope you all like them!

*backstreet boys/the xmas song* https://www.youtube.c*m/watch?v=q-6c3YorjmQ
*the carpenters/merry xmas darling* https://www.youtube.c*m/watch?v=PB5c-KmxqQw
*jackson 5/santa claus is coming to town* https://www.youtube.c*m/watch?v=B9u4JuEOKsU
*justin bieber ft boyz to men/fa la la* https://www.youtube.c*m/watch?v=QBDcc41JXMU
*nsync/merry xmas, happy holidays* https://www.youtube.c*m/watch?v=oeLfuIzF6v8
*whitney houston/do u hear what i hear?* https://www.youtube.c*m/watch?v=-mXc0xrPt04
*elvis presley/blue xmas* https://www.youtube.c*m/watch?v=B6WnnZRSKYs
*hanson/ run run rudolph* https://www.youtube.c*m/watch?v=lpq5oH0oFvw
*celine dion/don't save it all for xmas day* https://www.youtube.c*m/watch?v=qdRncshZ4Vw
*josh groban/o holy night* https://www.youtube.c*m/watch?v=8Uh6X7WB5UE
*boyz to men/let it snow* https://www.youtube.c*m/watch?v=TasbOmC4NNo

& last but not least, not a big hit @ the time, but this song made it on the home alone 2 soundtrack. i was a huge tlc fan, but can't remember this on mtv or on the radio, but enjoy everyone! lisa's raps are great on this one: *tlc/sleigh ride* https://www.youtube.c*m/watch?v=JTL2QGlibo4

drupalComments.title: d74b651d-cff9-4251-b8f3-86e920453c8c
drupalComments.body:
Getting proper boring now.
Although what is interesting, is that some of the classics that have been gaining higher and higher annual peaks as the years of streaming go on, are now on the way down (attaining lower peaks again).

Some examples:
Fairytale, Shaky, Band Aid, Andy Williams, Chris Rea, and probably a few more.
They're also starting to have fewer weeks on chart each year, going down from 6 with a mid-November start. I'd call them the A-list (along with some still attaining top peaks: Wham/Mariah).

The B-list are still on the way up or equalling previous peaks: Brenda Lee, Bobby Helms, Michael Bubble.

The C-list (those that previously failed to make the top 75 that now scrape or just fail to make the top 40), are still attaining higher peaks:
Let It Snow (many versions), Christmas Song, Burl Ives etc.

drupalComments.title: f08985b7-abe9-4021-8af3-626d1aeeb27c
drupalComments.body:
As much as I wanted Christmas Drillings to get number 1, it hasn't quite taken it for me either :(, but Central Cee did well this week, it's my Christmas Number 1!
So my Christmas Number 1 Album has to go to 23, because this album is pretty much the only 1 I have listened to this week!!

My Christmas Chart:

children.title: d8245709-cddc-4d6b-a82d-bc3f1999d09f
children.body:
The Beatles clearly were good enough to get 17 #1 singles in total (I think only Elvis has more), spread across 65 weeks. That's about an average of four weeks per #1 single!

LadBaby only have five in total, not even a third of that figure, with none of them spending a second week in the Top 25, let alone at the top! I think it should be obvious as to whose legacy is bigger.

Besides, you can't base an artist's success on one particular week of the year! 😭

drupalComments.title: aeca26d9-e624-45da-b085-c8a70e6c25a0
drupalComments.body:
i’ve been too generous about this recently.

it shouldn’t be as deep as it is, but as much as i don’t care about the charts anymore, i care about other people’s feelings. and everyone here’s probably feeling like at the moment, because ladbaby just stole christmas for a 5th year in a row.

the christmas chart race is not just any chart, but a british tradition. the last time we’ve had an original christmas number 1 was in 2017 - since then, we’ve had two tory-supporting b*st*rds claiming the christmas number 1 without giving anyone else a chance! i’m happy people are donating to the trussel trust as it’s an incredible charity, but 1) you can donate directly and even give more than just 99p, which is far more important; 2) these little greeds are STEALING a fraction of the purchases. they can’t stand the thought of change either - as soon as wham caught up, they released remixes the following morning. now if that’s not desperation, what is??

it also doesn’t help that the song is the same as the previous four - a cynical attempt at novelty with sausage roll references thrown in. granted, it’s better than last year’s car crash, but considering that’s the worst number 1 of all time it’s not hard to be better. comparing the uk’s food bank situation with ethiopia’s crisis is not it as well, they had it far, FAR worse.

i wanted raye or the sidemen to get there. no, actually, scrap that; i wanted ANYONE to get there other than ladbaby, and i’m certain y’all are thinking similarly. the sidemen put out a post on instagram saying that they’re thankful of the support regardless of the final position - that’s a great attitude to have as a charting artist. also, they encouraged direct donations to the charity they were donating to from the proceeds of christmas drillings. that’s saying a f*ckton!! meanwhile, ladbaby support the conservatives who are the reason food banks exist, and don’t donate the whole thing!

tl;dr - the christmas charts don’t matter anymore. ladbaby took the tradition away.

Chart talk aside, I hope everyone here has a wonderful Christmas or anything else they may be celebrating instead. :)

In particular, I want to say a MASSIVE thank you to all the frontline health workers who may be reading this!

Instead of being with family or friends on Christmas Day, they’ll be working tirelessly to save the lives of many British people, despite the unimaginably tough conditions they face.

You are all absolute heroes to our country! 🌈
